Study Title: Cetuximab, Capecitabine, Oxaliplatin and Bevacizumab in Advanced Colorectal Cancer
Brief Summary:
This is a study to assess the efficacy and safety of the addition of cetuximab to the combined regimen of capecitabine, oxaliplatin and bevacizumab in patients with previously untreated advanced colorectal carcinoma. It is an open, comparative study, comparing the effects of capecitabine, oxaliplatin and bevacizumab to those of the same regimen plus cetuximab.

Seven hundred fifty patients will be included. Treatment will continue until disease progression or serious toxicity and follow up will continue until death. It is anticipated that the addition of cetuximab will lead to an increase in progression free survival.
Interventions: DRUG: 21Capecitabine + bevacizumab + oxaliplatin|DRUG: 1Capecitabine + oxaliplatin + bevacizumab + cetuximab
Primary Outcome Measures: progression free survival, study duration|toxicity, study duration
Secondary Outcome Measures: tumour response (complete response [CR], partial response [PR] or stable disease [SD]), study duration|response duration, study duration|overall survival, study duration|quality of life, study duration|translational research, study duration
Study Design: Allocation: RANDOMIZED|Intervention Model: PARALLEL|Masking: NONE|Primary Purpose: TREATMENT
Locations: University Medical Center Nijmegen, Nijmegen, Gelderland, Netherlands
